Sedona Certified Platforms

One of the steps involved in getting your platform Sedona certified is that is must pass all tests when run against the sedonacert test suite. The sedonacert program verifies that 1) your platform is compliant with the Sox protocol and 2) your platform can be provisioned in a standard way. In order for your platform to pass the tests for provisioning, it must implement the following requirements:

Requirements

App and Scode naming requirements

When your platform starts, it must use app.sab as the name of the application binary to load, and it must use kits.scode as the name of the scode image to load.

When your platform starts, if it detects an app.sab.stage or a kits.scode.stage file, it should rename those files to app.sab and kits.scode respectively, and then use those files as the application binary and scode images to load.

Standard provisioning process requirements

Your platform must be able to support the following sequence of actions to provision a new app.sab and kits.scode file on your platform

  1. Put a file called app.sab.writing
  2. Put a file called kits.scode.writing
  3. Rename app.sab.writing to app.sab.stage
  4. Rename kits.scode.writing to kits.scode.stage
  5. Restart the device by invoking the restart() action on the platform service

When the device restarts it should use the staged app and scode file as described in the requirements above.
